ovdesc.p: This table is used to setup parameters that should be taken into account to decide the holidays in order to arrive at next business day. The setup will be in a manner which can be processed by the payments hub using peeling logic.

desc.p: Holds the date type for which the holiday logic is to be applied.
Specifies if debit currency non-working days are to be considered for the calculation of DateType value.
When "Y" is set, holiday calculation is based on PPT.CURRENCYNONWORKINGDAY.
Specifies the date until which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.Post this date, the record will be set as Inactive by the payments hub.
Record Activation Code generated for the record by the payment's hub.

Specifies the order (sequence) of the record in the application. Based on the value, a record is prioritised in such a way that, it is given higher preference for selection under peeling logic applied in the payments hub.
Record Status Code generated for the record by the payments hub.
Specifies the date from which the record is to be considered as active for payments processing.
Specifies if non-working days for the applicable trade currencies are to be considered for calculation of DateType value. List of applicable trade currencies would be defined at company level.
When "Y" is set, holiday calculation is based on PPT.CURRENCYNONWORKINGDAY.
Specifies if country non-working days for the processing bank are to be considered while calculating the DateType value.
When "Y" is set, holiday calculation is based on PPT.COUNTRYNONWORKINGDAY.
Specifies if country non-working days are to be considered in the calculation of DateType value
When "Y" is set, holiday calculation is based on PPT.COUNTRYNONWORKINGDAY.
Specifies if clearing non-working days are to be considered in the calculation of DateType value.
When "Y" is set, holiday calculation is based on PPT.CLEARINGNONWORKINGDAY.
Indicates the company ID for which the record is created.
The value links to the field ‘CompanyID’ in PPT.COMPANY

Holds the credit currency code which will be used as a criteria to identify the record. If the credit account currency is not present in the payment order; while looking up the PPT_HolidayLogic table, transaction currency of the payment must be passed as the input criteria to match CreditCurrency field.
The value links to field 'CurrrencyCode' in PPT.CURRENCY
If left blank, a default value of '*' will be set.
Specifies if credit currency non-working days are to be considered in the calculation of DateType value.
When "Y" is set, holiday calculation is based on PPT.CURRENCYNONWORKINGDAY.
Holds the country code of the receiving bank with which the credit party holds an account with.The value will be a match criteria to identify the record.
The value links to ID in COUNTRY
If left blank, a default value of '*' will be set.
Specifies if non-working days of credit party country are to be considered for the calculation of DateType value.
When "Y" is set, holiday calculation is based on PPT.COUNTRYNONWORKINGDAY.
